response.answer_text: Cellulose is a polysaccharide. It’s made up of lots of β glucose molecules bonded together by a condensation reaction. Disaccharides are made up of two monosaccharides joined by condensation. Note that β glucose is a monosaccharide. Cellulose has thousands of times more monosaccharides than disaccharides. They are very different.
No. Cellulose is a kind of polysccharide, which lots of carbohydrate molecules are linked together. Disaccharide only involves 2 carbohydrate molecules.
